sentence: U.S. stocks were poised to open higher on Tuesday amid higher-than-expected housing starts and permits and as the European Central Bank said it would boost asset purchases in May and June to maintain the average at 60 billion euros ($67 billion) through the summer holiday.
Housing starts jumped 20.2% to 1.135 million compared to the estimated 1.029 million.
The consensus range was between 970,000 to 1.120 million, according to data compiled by Econoday.
March housing starts were revised up to 944,000 from 926,000.
Housing permits meanwhile rose 10.1% to 1.143 million, beating the 1.070 million average estimate as well as the consensus range between 1.050 million and 1.120 million.

March permits were revised to 1.038 Mln From 1.039 Mln

In equities, Wal-Mart Stores ( WMT ) was down over 2% in recent pre-market trade as its fiscal Q1 earnings and revenue missed analysts' estimates.
Meanwhile, home improvement retailer Home Depot ( HD ) rose nearly 2% after its Q1 beat estimates, with comparable sales up 6.1% in the quarter.

(+) PLUG (+8.1%) Says unnamed "big-box retailer" is new customer

(-) DKS (-4.0%) Q2, FY results seen in line to below Street

(-) ARP (-8.1%) To acquire assets from Atlas Energy, sells 6.5 million shares in offering

(-) YGE (-32.9%) Hits all-time low after flagging doubt about ability to continue
